concept.title: Develop Risk Assessment and Rescue Plan for Working at Heights Tasks

audience.otherprops: safety and compliance officers, industrial engineers, maintenance personnel, supervisors, rescue team members

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Develop risk assessment and rescue plan for working at heights tasks

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Guidance to perform task based risk assessments and to create rescue plans for work at heights in plant operations.

othermeta.name: taxonomy

ol.li: During preparation phase for Work at Height and risk assessment, a specific rescue plan must be defined and appropriate work permits issued as per EHS-02-103 F003 Working at Height Permit.

For the purpose of Work at Height Rescue risk assessment, the below elements have to be taken into consideration:
Type and extent of the hazards for the people involved in the rescue.
Definition of the required properties of the rescue equipment.
Determination of the appropriate rescue procedure:
Active Rescue (Rescuer person can be lowered together with the Fallen Employee).
Passive Rescue (Rescuer stands on a safe level).
Determination of the appropriate rescue equipment (belts, loops, lifting devices, descenders, connecting elements, anchor devices, cherry pickers, etc.).
Determination of the rescue routes.

Assessment and selection of rescue equipment shall involve:
Suitability for the given conditions.
Suitability according to ergonomic requirements.
Ensure that the rescue concept is understood and agreed with: area managers/superiors and teammates as well as the plant fire brigade if applicable.
Make sure there are contact numbers for outside rescue services (e.g., Local Fire Department) available and known.
Confirm that Rescuer(s) are physically fit and have extensive knowledge of the equipment and practical experience.
